availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Vanhook (Pulaski County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Pulaski County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Jane Morgan Vanhook in Pulaski County, Kentucky, on October 23, 1848. Father of George C. Vanhook, William M. Vanhook, and Milton G. Vanhook. Farmer in Pulaski County, Kentucky, in 1860. Justice of the peace in Pulaski County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, District 1, p. 216.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Cumberland County, District 9, p. 190A.
"James Harvey Vanhook (1823-1910)," Find A Grave, Memorial #44660516, accessed January 20, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/44660516.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994053, Pulaski County Marriages, p. 184.
KYR-0001-031-0077.
